alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 9:42PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Richmond, northeastern Caroline, Westmoreland and northwestern Essex Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 941 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Port Royal to near Colonial Beach. Movement was east to southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Colonial Beach around 950 PM EDT. Loretto around 1000 PM EDT. Leedstown around 1005 PM EDT. Champlain around 1010 PM EDT. Newland around 1020 PM EDT. Montross around 1025 PM EDT. Warsaw, Coles Point and Hague around 1030 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Lerty, Ethel, Currioman Landing, Potomac Beach, Oak Grove, Supply, Singerly, Mount Holly, Peeds and Foneswood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
